title: WO-06: Turtle interpreter v1 (no stack)
intent: Create a minimal deterministic turtle interpreter that converts an expanded L-system string into an ordered list of 2D line segments.
forbidden: Do not modify files outside allowed_files.
Do not implement bracket stack handling ([ and ]) or the non-drawing move command (f) in this step (defer to WO-07).
Do not implement rasterization, PNG encoding, render pipeline wiring, or CLI changes in this step.
acceptance_commands: python -c "from lsysviz.turtle import to_segments; segs = to_segments('F+F', angle_degrees=90, step=10); assert len(segs) == 2"
notes: Type: additive-feature. Contracts (frozen): segment output format is a list of ((x0,y0),(x1,y1)) float tuples in world coordinates. Deterministic semantics in this step: 'F' draws forward by step (adds one segment), '+' turns left by angle_degrees, '-' turns right by angle_degrees; all other symbols are ignored (no-op). Heading convention is frozen: start at (0.0, 0.0) with heading_degrees=0 pointing up (+Y). Compositionality: isolates geometry interpretation; stack/branching is added later without changing the v1 command semantics.
